metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20429 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
In the Lustre file system before 2.12.3, the ptlrpc module has an out-of-bounds read and panic (via a modified lm_bufcount field) due to the lack of validation for specific fields of packets sent by a client. This is caused by interaction between sptlrpc_svc_unwrap_request and lustre_msg_hdr_size_v2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20429` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1010-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1016-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1016-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1016-raspi - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1010-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1016-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1016-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> lustre was removed from the upstream staging tree in 4.18 (be65f9ed267fd7d8b3146b7c4be9ecdd3e0aa3ed)

criterions.comment: linux-ibm package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1002.2').
linux-lowlatency package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-24.24').
linux-raspi package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1005.5').
linux-signed-ibm package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1002.2').
linux-signed-lowlatency package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-24.24').
